Assets.Functionality: Stores node ID and maximum core information.
Assets.Justification: Misconfigured access to this register could expose sensitive system configuration information.

Justification of Related CWE-IDs.CWE-1191: The CoreID Register in the Debug module could be accessed through improperly secured debug interfaces, allowing unauthorized access to sensitive system configuration information.
Justification of Related CWE-IDs.CWE-1244: The CoreID Register may be exposed to unsafe debug access levels if the debug interface does not enforce correct access levels, leading to unauthorized access to sensitive configuration data.
Justification of Related CWE-IDs.CWE-1262: Improper access control for the CoreID Register interface could allow unauthorized reads of sensitive node ID and core information, compromising confidentiality.
Justification of Related CWE-IDs.CWE-1263: If physical access controls are insufficient, an attacker could exploit debug ports to access the CoreID Register, exposing sensitive system configuration information.

Justification of Related CAPEC-IDs.CAPEC-180: By exploiting CWE CWE-1191, CAPEC-180 could manipulate the Debug IP's diagnostic access to the CoreID Register, leading to unauthorized disclosure of node ID and core configuration, thus compromising confidentiality.
Justification of Related CAPEC-IDs.CAPEC-121: CAPEC-121 can exploit CWE CWE-1191 by injecting erroneous control signals through the Debug IP, potentially altering the CoreID Register's data and breaching confidentiality by exposing sensitive system configuration.

Justification of Related CAPEC-IDs.CAPEC-114: CAPEC-114 exploits CWE CWE-1244 by manipulating diagnostic access controls to the CoreID Register, potentially leading to unauthorized disclosure of node ID and core configuration, thereby compromising confidentiality.
Justification of Related CAPEC-IDs.CAPEC-121: CAPEC-121 leverages CWE CWE-1244 by injecting erroneous control signals into the Debug IP, which could misconfigure access permissions to the CoreID Register, resulting in unauthorized exposure of sensitive system configuration data.

Justification of Related CAPEC-IDs.CAPEC-680: By exploiting CWE-1262, an attacker could use CAPEC-680 to manipulate the Debug IP's diagnostic access controls, leading to unauthorized reads of the CoreID Register and compromising the confidentiality of node ID and core configuration information.
Justification of Related CAPEC-IDs.CAPEC-121: Through CWE-1262, CAPEC-121 could be used to craft malicious diagnostic requests that bypass access restrictions, resulting in the exposure of sensitive CoreID Register data and violating its confidentiality objective.

Justification of Related CAPEC-IDs.CAPEC-401: CAPEC-401 exploits CWE CWE-1263 by leveraging unauthorized access to the CoreID Register in the Debug IP module, potentially leading to information disclosure of sensitive node ID and core configuration data, thus compromising confidentiality.
